conclusion: To determine if the distance fallen is greater or less than 75 meters, calculate the area under the v-t graph.
Identify the interval of interest from 10 to 15 seconds.
At 10 seconds, the velocity is approximately 20 m/s. At 15 seconds, the velocity is approximately 10 m/s.
The area under the graph from 10 to 15 seconds is roughly a trapezoid.
The formula for the area of a trapezoid is (1/2) * (b1 + b2) * h.
Assign values: b1 = 20 m/s, b2 = 10 m/s, h = 5 seconds.
The area calculated is 75 m², representing the distance fallen.
The distance fallen during the interval is exactly 75 meters.
